comments.creator: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.author: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.text:
Breadcrumbs on the page header are sometimes annoying, so putting them on the footer would be appropriate here.

Example:
http://mozilla.jp/firefox/security/phishing-protection/ (my implementation)
http://www.apple.com/iphone/business/profiles/

Breadcrumbs can be markuped with the Schema.org vocabulary (Bug 705534).
comments.raw_text:
Breadcrumbs on the page header are sometimes annoying, so putting them on the footer would be appropriate here.

Example:
http://mozilla.jp/firefox/security/phishing-protection/ (my implementation)
http://www.apple.com/iphone/business/profiles/

Breadcrumbs can be markuped with the Schema.org vocabulary (Bug 705534).

FYI: looks like an example on http://schema.org/WebPage is wrong. It has been tracked by http://www.w3.org/2011/webschema/track/issues/10 maybe wrong: >
> Books > > Literature & Fiction > > Classics >
maybe right: >
> Books > > Literature & Fiction > > Classics >
comments.author: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
What if we made breadcrumbs as list items (
) instead of div with an anchor tag? The list items will gracefully degrade to bullets with CSS disabled.
comments.author: chrismore.bugzilla@gmail.com
comments.text:
What if we made breadcrumbs as list items (
) instead of div with an anchor tag? The list items will gracefully degrade to bullets with CSS disabled.
comments.creator: chrismore.bugzilla@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: Sometimes <ul> or <ol> (e.g. Apple) are used but are not suitable for breadcrumbs markup because those elements are for parallel lists.
comments.creator: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.author: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.text: Sometimes <ul> or <ol> (e.g. Apple) are used but are not suitable for breadcrumbs markup because those elements are for parallel lists.

comments.raw_text: We should wait until the new websites information architect designer starts to decide on how we should implement this. Whatever we come up with can be rolled into One Mozilla design standards.
comments.creator: chrismore.bugzilla@gmail.com
comments.text: We should wait until the new websites information architect designer starts to decide on how we should implement this. Whatever we come up with can be rolled into One Mozilla design standards.

comments.text: We will also need to find a clever way to do it easily on the Python/Jinja side.

comments.text: This is not related to One Mozilla actually. The breadcrumbs spec is somehow still on hold. I'll reopen this and send a PR once the final spec gets published.

comments.text: Currently 23 templates have breadcrumbs, and there are more pages including security advisories. The spec has been developed by Googlers so Google may support it sooner or later. I personally think it's complicated though.
comments.author: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.creator: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com

comments.text:
I have confirmed with my project site that Google has recently started to support http://schema.org/BreadcrumbList. See this for example, pages are still being indexed at this time though:

https://www.google.ca/search?q=site:https://www.fxsitecompat.com/en-US/

I'll send a PR for this once I have time.
comments.author: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
comments.creator: kohei.yoshino@gmail.com
